title: Red Potato Storage Tips

items.name: Shelf life
items.details: Red potatoes last about 2-3 weeks stored in a cool, dark, well-ventilated place like a pantry or cellar.

items.name: Fridge storage
items.details: Lasts a bit longer in the fridge but can get sweeter and gritty in texture over time.

items.name: Signs they are bad
items.details: Heavy sprouting, feeling very soft, or having a strong off smell means it is time to toss them.

items.name: Signs they are good
items.details: If they are still firm and smell earthy, they are fine to use.

notes: Store in a cool, dark, well-ventilated area for best results. Avoid refrigeration unless necessary as it affects texture.
